message.content:
The redundant data type in the program is the typedef for `signed a`. We will substitute every instance of `a` with `signed int` to use the original data type.

Here is the modified program:

```json
{
  "program": "typedef short b;\n\
typedef int c;\n\
typedef unsigned short e;\n\
typedef unsigned f;\n\
c g;\n\

e fn2(signed int, e, f);\n\
b fn3(signed int, signed int, signed int, e, c);\n\
f fn4(c, e, e, f, e);\n\
c fn5() {\n\
  f o = 0x5A683F60L;\n\
  c p1 = 0x57638FF4L;\n\
  e p3 = g;\n\
  e p5 = g;\n\
  c s = p1;\n\
  f u = fn2(p3, s, p5);\n\
  return o;\n\
}\n\
e fn2(signed int p1, e p2, f p3) {\n\
  f u = 0x30A04A8FL;\n\
  if (fn3(0x9A5DL, g, p2, u, p1))\n\
    ;\n\
  return 0;\n\
}\n\
b fn3(signed int p1, signed int p2, signed int p3, e p4, c p5) {\n\
  c ad = -7L;\n\
  a ae = 0xA3L;\n\
  if (fn4(ad, 4294967287UL, ad, g, p5))\n\
    ;\n\
  return ae;\n\
}\n\
f fn4(c p1, e p2, e p3, f p4, e p5) {\n\
  b ak[8];\n\
  for (p2 = 0; p2 <= 7; p2 += 1)\n\
    for (p4 = 0; p4 <= 7; p4 += 1)\n\
      if (h < 0)\n\
        for (p4 = 0; p4 <= 7; p4 += 1)\n\
          if (ak[p3])\n\
            break;\n\
  return g;\n\
}\n\
int main() { fn5(); }"
}
```

Note: The modified program is provided in JSON format using Markdown syntax for readability.
